bibl.title: Demeter-Isis or the Egyptian Demeter? A Graeco-Roman Sculpture from an Egyptian Workshop in Boston. Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.note: Boston, Museum of Fine Arts, Inv. 1970.242. Marble, H. 81 cm. Demeter. Alexandria, ca. A.D. 160-190. Terracotta statuettes, bronze statuettes and bronze coins from Egypt make it clear that the basic design (second half of the IVth century B.C.) was influenced by a succession of other Hellenistic Demeter images. - Pp. 113-122: Catalogue (Nos 1-107)
bibl.seg: HERRMANN John J., Jr., Demeter-Isis or the Egyptian Demeter? A Graeco-Roman Sculpture from an Egyptian Workshop in Boston. Avec résumé en anglais.

Boston, Museum of Fine Arts, Inv. 1970.242. Marble, H. 81 cm. Demeter. Alexandria, ca. A.D. 160-190. Terracotta statuettes, bronze statuettes and bronze coins from Egypt make it clear that the basic design (second half of the IVth century B.C.) was influenced by a succession of other Hellenistic Demeter images. - Pp. 113-122: Catalogue (Nos 1-107)
